sections.markdown:
# Automate business analytics with GRAIL DQL 
---
  This is a sample for educational purposes only and not officially part of the product. 

---

## Description
In this notebook, we use 3 datasources (these datasources are simulated into the notebook by the [DQL command data](https://docs.dynatrace.com/docs/shortlink/dql-commands#data))
  - File1, processing of gains, which contains `start_time` and `betID` 
  - File2, correlation id, which contains `betID` and `runID`
  - File3, online payment, which contains `runID` and `end_time`

## Demo in 3 steps : 

- Calculate the delay payment

    ``payment_delay=end_time-start_time``

- Calculate the SLO 

    ``objective = 99% < 12 min payment delay on default period``

- Create the workflow: "if SLO is not successful"

    ``Send the result on webhook``  
    ``Ingest metrics on your classic tenant``

  ![Payment_delay](https://github.com/dynatrace-ace-services/DIY_Automate_Business_Analytics_with_DQL/blob/main/payment_delay.png?raw=true)

## File 1: Processing of gains
contains `start_time`, `betID`

-  display the result

input.value:
data 
    record(timestamp=now()-45m, log.source="file1", content="betID=BET_20231019160000, start_time=20231019160000986, winners=65"),
    record(timestamp=now()-30m, log.source="file1", content="betID=BET_20231019161501, start_time=20231019161501986, winners=47"),
    record(timestamp=now()-15m, log.source="file1", content="betID=BET_20231019163101, start_time=20231019163101986, winners=118")
| parse content,"'betID=' WORD:betID ', start_time='TIMESTAMP('yyyyMMddHHmmssSSS'):start_time ', winners='INT:nbr_winners"
//fields
| fields start_time, betID, nbr_winners

grail.canonicalQuery:
data record({timestamp = now() - 45m}, {log.source = "file1"}, {content = "betID=BET_20231019160000, start_time=20231019160000986, winners=65"}), record({timestamp = now() - 30m}, {log.source = "file1"}, {content = "betID=BET_20231019161501, start_time=20231019161501986, winners=47"}), record({timestamp = now() - 15m}, {log.source = "file1"}, {content = "betID=BET_20231019163101, start_time=20231019163101986, winners=118"})
| parse content, "'betID=' WORD:betID ', start_time='TIMESTAMP('yyyyMMddHHmmssSSS'):start_time ', winners='INT:nbr_winners"
| fields start_time, betID, nbr_winners
| limit 0
grail.query:
data 
    record(timestamp=now()-45m, log.source="file1", content="betID=BET_20231019160000, start_time=20231019160000986, winners=65"),
    record(timestamp=now()-30m, log.source="file1", content="betID=BET_20231019161501, start_time=20231019161501986, winners=47"),
    record(timestamp=now()-15m, log.source="file1", content="betID=BET_20231019163101, start_time=20231019163101986, winners=118")
| parse content,"'betID=' WORD:betID ', start_time='TIMESTAMP('yyyyMMddHHmmssSSS'):start_time ', winners='INT:nbr_winners"
| fields start_time, betID, nbr_winners
| limit 0

input.value:
data 
    record(timestamp=now()-45m, log.source="file1", content="betID=BET_20231019160000, start_time=20231019160000986, winners=65"),
    record(timestamp=now()-30m, log.source="file1", content="betID=BET_20231019161501, start_time=20231019161501986, winners=47"),
    record(timestamp=now()-15m, log.source="file1", content="betID=BET_20231019163101, start_time=20231019163101986, winners=118")
| parse content,"'betID=' WORD:betID ', start_time='TIMESTAMP('yyyyMMddHHmmssSSS'):start_time ', winners='INT:nbr_winners"
| fields start_time, betID, nbr_winners
| limit 0

sections.markdown:
# File2: Correlation ID
contains `betID`, `runID`
- display the result with the runID and betID correlation

input.value:
data 
    record(timestamp=now()-43m, log.source="file2", content="betID=BET_20231019160000, runID=2023101900045"),
    record(timestamp=now()-28m, log.source="file2", content="betID=BET_20231019161501, runID=2023101900055"),
    record(timestamp=now()-12m, log.source="file2", content="betID=BET_20231019163101, runID=2023101900065")
| parse content,"'betID=' WORD:betID ', runID=' WORD:runID"
//fields
| fields betID, runID

grail.canonicalQuery:
data record({timestamp = now() - 43m}, {log.source = "file2"}, {content = "betID=BET_20231019160000, runID=2023101900045"}), record({timestamp = now() - 28m}, {log.source = "file2"}, {content = "betID=BET_20231019161501, runID=2023101900055"}), record({timestamp = now() - 12m}, {log.source = "file2"}, {content = "betID=BET_20231019163101, runID=2023101900065"})
| parse content, "'betID=' WORD:betID ', runID=' WORD:runID"
| fields betID, runID
| limit 0
grail.query:
data 
    record(timestamp=now()-43m, log.source="file2", content="betID=BET_20231019160000, runID=2023101900045"),
    record(timestamp=now()-28m, log.source="file2", content="betID=BET_20231019161501, runID=2023101900055"),
    record(timestamp=now()-12m, log.source="file2", content="betID=BET_20231019163101, runID=2023101900065")
| parse content,"'betID=' WORD:betID ', runID=' WORD:runID"
| fields betID, runID
| limit 0

input.value:
data 
    record(timestamp=now()-43m, log.source="file2", content="betID=BET_20231019160000, runID=2023101900045"),
    record(timestamp=now()-28m, log.source="file2", content="betID=BET_20231019161501, runID=2023101900055"),
    record(timestamp=now()-12m, log.source="file2", content="betID=BET_20231019163101, runID=2023101900065")
| parse content,"'betID=' WORD:betID ', runID=' WORD:runID"
| fields betID, runID
| limit 0

sections.markdown:
## File3: Online payment
contains `runID`, `end_time`
- display the result

input.value:
data 
    record(timestamp=now()-41m, log.source="file3", content="runID=2023101900045, end_time=2023/10/19 16:04:30"),
    record(timestamp=now()-26m, log.source="file3", content="runID=2023101900055, end_time=2023/10/19 16:20:00"),
    record(timestamp=now()-10m, log.source="file3", content="runID=2023101900065, end_time=2023/10/19 16:45:30")
| parse content,"'runID=' WORD:runID ', end_time='TIMESTAMP('yyyy/MM/d HH:mm:ss'):end_time"
//fields
| fields runID, end_time

grail.canonicalQuery:
data record({timestamp = now() - 41m}, {log.source = "file3"}, {content = "runID=2023101900045, end_time=2023/10/19 16:01:30"}), record({timestamp = now() - 26m}, {log.source = "file3"}, {content = "runID=2023101900055, end_time=2023/10/19 16:18:00"}), record({timestamp = now() - 10m}, {log.source = "file3"}, {content = "runID=2023101900065, end_time=2023/10/19 16:38:30"})
| parse content, "'runID=' WORD:runID ', end_time='TIMESTAMP('yyyy/MM/d HH:mm:ss'):end_time"
| fields runID, end_time
| limit 0
grail.query:
data 
    record(timestamp=now()-41m, log.source="file3", content="runID=2023101900045, end_time=2023/10/19 16:01:30"),
    record(timestamp=now()-26m, log.source="file3", content="runID=2023101900055, end_time=2023/10/19 16:18:00"),
    record(timestamp=now()-10m, log.source="file3", content="runID=2023101900065, end_time=2023/10/19 16:38:30")
| parse content,"'runID=' WORD:runID ', end_time='TIMESTAMP('yyyy/MM/d HH:mm:ss'):end_time"
| fields runID, end_time
| limit 0

input.value:
data 
    record(timestamp=now()-41m, log.source="file3", content="runID=2023101900045, end_time=2023/10/19 16:01:30"),
    record(timestamp=now()-26m, log.source="file3", content="runID=2023101900055, end_time=2023/10/19 16:18:00"),
    record(timestamp=now()-10m, log.source="file3", content="runID=2023101900065, end_time=2023/10/19 16:38:30")
| parse content,"'runID=' WORD:runID ', end_time='TIMESTAMP('yyyy/MM/d HH:mm:ss'):end_time"
| fields runID, end_time
| limit 0

sections.markdown:
## Step 1.1 : create a lookup with file2 and file3 based on runID
For multiple lookups, it's easier to start by the end. 
- fill the `<datasource>` below to create the lookup with `file2` and `file3` based on `runID` and catch the lookup field `end_time`
- display the result on `betID`, `runID`, `end_time`

input.value:
//file2
data 
    record(timestamp=now()-43m, log.source="file2", content="betID=BET_20231019160000, runID=2023101900045"),
    record(timestamp=now()-28m, log.source="file2", content="betID=BET_20231019161501, runID=2023101900055"),
    record(timestamp=now()-12m, log.source="file2", content="betID=BET_20231019163101, runID=2023101900065")
| parse content,"'betID=' WORD:betID ', runID=' WORD:runID"
| fields timestamp, betID, runID
| lookup[
        //file3
        data 
            record(timestamp=now()-41m, log.source="file3", content="runID=2023101900045, end_time=2023/10/19 16:04:30"),
            record(timestamp=now()-26m, log.source="file3", content="runID=2023101900055, end_time=2023/10/19 16:20:00"),
            record(timestamp=now()-10m, log.source="file3", content="runID=2023101900065, end_time=2023/10/19 16:45:30")
        | parse content,"'runID=' WORD:runID ', end_time='TIMESTAMP('yyyy/MM/d HH:mm:ss'):end_time"
        ], sourceField: runID, lookupField: runID, fields:{end_time}
| fields betID,runID, end_time
//comment the mask : add comment "//" on these latest lines and run query to display the result
| fields solution="To show the solution : click on \"Show Query\" and comment the mask at the end of this DQL request"
| limit 1

records.solution: To show the solution : click on "Show Query" and comment the mask at the end of this DQL request

grail.canonicalQuery:
data record({timestamp = now() - 43m}, {log.source = "file2"}, {content = "betID=BET_20231019160000, runID=2023101900045"}), record({timestamp = now() - 28m}, {log.source = "file2"}, {content = "betID=BET_20231019161501, runID=2023101900055"}), record({timestamp = now() - 12m}, {log.source = "file2"}, {content = "betID=BET_20231019163101, runID=2023101900065"})
| parse content, "'betID=' WORD:betID ', runID=' WORD:runID"
| fields timestamp, betID, runID
| lookup 
	[
		data record({timestamp = now() - 41m}, {log.source = "file3"}, {content = "runID=2023101900045, end_time=2023/10/19 16:04:30"}), record({timestamp = now() - 26m}, {log.source = "file3"}, {content = "runID=2023101900055, end_time=2023/10/19 16:20:00"}), record({timestamp = now() - 10m}, {log.source = "file3"}, {content = "runID=2023101900065, end_time=2023/10/19 16:45:30"})
		| parse content, "'runID=' WORD:runID ', end_time='TIMESTAMP('yyyy/MM/d HH:mm:ss'):end_time"
	], sourceField:runID, lookupField:runID, fields:{end_time}
| fields betID, runID, end_time
| fields "To show the solution : click on \"Show Query\" and comment the mask at the end of this DQL request", alias:solution
| limit 1
grail.query:
//file2
data 
    record(timestamp=now()-43m, log.source="file2", content="betID=BET_20231019160000, runID=2023101900045"),
    record(timestamp=now()-28m, log.source="file2", content="betID=BET_20231019161501, runID=2023101900055"),
    record(timestamp=now()-12m, log.source="file2", content="betID=BET_20231019163101, runID=2023101900065")
| parse content,"'betID=' WORD:betID ', runID=' WORD:runID"
| fields timestamp, betID, runID
| lookup[
        //file3
        data 
            record(timestamp=now()-41m, log.source="file3", content="runID=2023101900045, end_time=2023/10/19 16:04:30"),
            record(timestamp=now()-26m, log.source="file3", content="runID=2023101900055, end_time=2023/10/19 16:20:00"),
            record(timestamp=now()-10m, log.source="file3", content="runID=2023101900065, end_time=2023/10/19 16:45:30")
        | parse content,"'runID=' WORD:runID ', end_time='TIMESTAMP('yyyy/MM/d HH:mm:ss'):end_time"
        ], sourceField: runID, lookupField: runID, fields:{end_time}
| fields betID,runID, end_time
//comment the mask : add comment "//" on these latest lines and run query to display the result
| fields solution="To show the solution : click on \"Show Query\" and comment the mask at the end of this DQL request"
| limit 1

input.value:
//file2
data 
    record(timestamp=now()-43m, log.source="file2", content="betID=BET_20231019160000, runID=2023101900045"),
    record(timestamp=now()-28m, log.source="file2", content="betID=BET_20231019161501, runID=2023101900055"),
    record(timestamp=now()-12m, log.source="file2", content="betID=BET_20231019163101, runID=2023101900065")
| parse content,"'betID=' WORD:betID ', runID=' WORD:runID"
| fields timestamp, betID, runID
| lookup[
        //file3
        data 
            record(timestamp=now()-41m, log.source="file3", content="runID=2023101900045, end_time=2023/10/19 16:04:30"),
            record(timestamp=now()-26m, log.source="file3", content="runID=2023101900055, end_time=2023/10/19 16:20:00"),
            record(timestamp=now()-10m, log.source="file3", content="runID=2023101900065, end_time=2023/10/19 16:45:30")
        | parse content,"'runID=' WORD:runID ', end_time='TIMESTAMP('yyyy/MM/d HH:mm:ss'):end_time"
        ], sourceField: runID, lookupField: runID, fields:{end_time}
| fields betID,runID, end_time
//comment the mask : add comment "//" on these latest lines and run query to display the result
| fields solution="To show the solution : click on \"Show Query\" and comment the mask at the end of this DQL request"
| limit 1

sections.markdown:
## Step 1.2 : create a lookup with file1 and the previous lookup based on betID
- fill the `<datasource>` below to create the lookup with `file1` and `result_1.1` based on `betID` and catch the lookup fields `runID` and `end_time`  
- display the result on : `start_time`, `payment_delay` = ( `end_time` - `start_time`)

records.solution: To show the solution : click on "Show Query" and comment the mask at the end of this DQL request

sections.markdown:
## Step 2 : Calculate SLO 
- Objective = 99% < 12 min payment_delay on default period
- display the result on: `SLO`, `target`, `SLO_success = if((SLO < target),false, else: true)`, `nbr_failed`, `total`
- for an optimized request, look at the end of this notebook

(Optional) - you can display the result in `Site Reliability Guardian`

input.value:
<result_1.2>
//SLO Calulation
| summarize nbr_failed=countIf(payment_delay > 12m), total=count()
| fieldsAdd SLO=(toDouble(total - nbr_failed) * 100 / total), target=99
| fields SLO, target, SLO_success = if((SLO < target),false, else: true), nbr_failed, total

records.solution: To show the solution : click on "Show Query" and comment the mask at the end of this DQL request

sections.markdown:
# Result SLO
- DQL request result
![result_lookup](https://github.com/dynatrace-ace-services/DIY_Automate_Business_Analytics_with_DQL/blob/main/result_slo.png?raw=true)
- Result with `Site Reliability Guardian`: display the DQL request only on the field `SLO`
![result_lookup_with_guardian](https://github.com/dynatrace-ace-services/DIY_Automate_Business_Analytics_with_DQL/blob/main/result_SLO_with_guardian.png?raw=true)

# STEP 3 : Create Workflow
- Start from `Step 2 : Calculate SLO`
- create a workflow from the DQL : click on `Automate DQL Query`
- rename the workflow : `DIY_Automate_Business_Analytics`

![Create workflow](https://github.com/dynatrace-ace-services/DIY_Automate_Business_Analytics_with_DQL/blob/main/create_workflow.png?raw=true)

# STEP 3.1:  Call a webhook if SLO fails

Create task "http_request_1"

## Prerequisite: add outbound connections
 ````
 Settings > Preferences > Limit outbound connections > Add items
 Allowed Host:  webhook.site
 ````

## Choose action
   ``````
   HTTP Request 
   ``````
## Input  
   ``````
   POST
   ``````
   
   ``````
   https://webhook.site/xxxxx  #your webhook.site url 
   ``````
   
   ``````
   {
   "SLO_success": "{{ result("execute_dql_query_1").records[0].SLO_success }}",  
   "SLO": "{{ result("execute_dql_query_1").records[0].SLO }}",  
   "target": "{{ result("execute_dql_query_1").records[0].target }}",  
   "nbr_failed": "{{ result("execute_dql_query_1").records[0].nbr_failed }}"  
   }
   ``````
set your name

## Conditions
  ``````
  {{ result("execute_dql_query_1").records[0].SLO_success == False }}
  ``````

## DQL request optimization 
- for a better performance we recommend joining logs with `summarize` DQL command on the same ID
- in this lab we can optimize one of both lookups (log1 with log 2 **OR** log2 with log3)  
- here is the solution with log1 & log2 optimized with `summarized`
You can try this request in `Site Reliability Guardian` and in the previous `workflow` :

input.value:
//optimized request
data //join with summarize on betID
    record(timestamp=now()-45m, log.source="file1", content="betID=BET_20231019160000, start_time=20231019160000986, winners=65"),
    record(timestamp=now()-30m, log.source="file1", content="betID=BET_20231019161501, start_time=20231019161501986, winners=47"),
    record(timestamp=now()-15m, log.source="file1", content="betID=BET_20231019163101, start_time=20231019163101986, winners=118"),

    record(timestamp=now()-43m, log.source="file2", content="betID=BET_20231019160000, runID=2023101900045"),
    record(timestamp=now()-28m, log.source="file2", content="betID=BET_20231019161501, runID=2023101900055"),
    record(timestamp=now()-12m, log.source="file2", content="betID=BET_20231019163101, runID=2023101900065")

 | parse content,"""'betID=' WORD:betID
					  ((', start_time='TIMESTAMP('yyyyMMddHHmmssSSS'):start_time )|
					   (', runID=' WORD:runID ))"""
	
  | summarize {
	    start_time = takeFirst(start_time),
		runID = takeFirst(runID)
		}, by: {betID} //joins with summarize end

| lookup[ //lookup on runID
        
        data           
            record(timestamp=now()-41m, log.source="file3", content="runID=2023101900045, end_time=2023/10/19 16:04:30"),
            record(timestamp=now()-26m, log.source="file3", content="runID=2023101900055, end_time=2023/10/19 16:20:00"),
            record(timestamp=now()-10m, log.source="file3", content="runID=2023101900065, end_time=2023/10/19 16:45:30")
        | parse content,"'runID=' WORD:runID ', end_time='TIMESTAMP('yyyy/MM/d HH:mm:ss'):end_time"
        
        ], sourceField: runID, lookupField: runID, fields:{end_time} //lookup end

| fields start_time, payment_delay=(end_time - start_time)

| summarize nbr_failed=countIf(payment_delay > 12m), total=count()
| fieldsAdd SLO=(toDouble(total - nbr_failed) * 100 / total), target=99
//| fields SLO, target, SLO_success = if((SLO < target),false, else: true), nbr_failed, total
